newsitem.title: JAPAN: Ex-Nomura chief arrested in racketeer case.
newsitem.headline: Ex-Nomura chief arrested in racketeer case.

text.p: Tokyo prosecutors said on Friday they had arrested former Nomura Securities Co Ltd president Hideo Sakamaki on suspicion of conspiring with three Nomura executives to give 38.5 million yen ($331,000) to racketeer Ryuichi Koike in March 1995.
The prosecutors said in a statement that they had arrested Sakamaki on suspicion of violating Japan's securities exchange law and the commercial code.

They said they believed the cash was given to the racketeer on March 15, 1995, as a token of appreciation for his future cooperation in making the company's shareholders' meeting, which was held in June, go smoothly.

Sakamaki, who stepped down as president in March and is now an adviser to the giant brokerage, told a parliamentary panel this week that he had briefly met Koike in 1992, but denied knowledge of any stock deals by the racketeer through Nomura.

The scandal -- the second involving Nomura in six years -- has not only hurt the brokerage's business but has also further tarnished the image of Japan's financial institutions at a critical time as they prepare to compete in Tokyo's increasingly deregulated markets. ($1=116 yen)
